headline: Why PayPal (PYPL) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of digital payments platform PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) fell 19.8% in the afternoon session after the company reported fourth-quarter 2025 results that missed Wall Street's expectations for both revenue and earnings. The digital payments company posted revenue of $8.68 billion, a 3.7% increase year on year, but this fell short of analyst estimates of $8.78 billion. Its adjusted earnings per share of $1.23 also missed the consensus forecast of $1.29. While PayPal's pre-tax profit margin improved

headline: PayPal Earnings Revealed Many Problems. A New CEO Can’t Keep the Stock From Tumbling.
summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

raw.headline: PayPal Earnings Revealed Many Problems. A New CEO Can’t Keep the Stock From Tumbling.
raw.summary: PayPal Holdings  made a splash Tuesday as it attempts to engineer a turnaround, replacing CEO Alex Chriss with current  HP Inc.  Chief Executive Enrique Lores.  Lores, who has served as HP’s CEO since 2019, will take the helm on March 1.  Jamie Miller, PayPal’s chief financial and operating officer, will serve as interim CEO for the rest of the month.

headline: PayPal's growing competition is a 'pressure point': Analyst
summary: PayPal's stock is sinking on Tuesday after reporting fourth quarter earnings results alongside a weak 2026 outlook. This news coincides with the payment platform picking HP Inc. (HPQ) CEO Enrique Lores to be its next chief executive, effective March 1. Enrique will be leaving his position at HP, which he's held since 2019. Macquarie Capital senior equity research analyst Paul Golding — who has an Outperform rating on the stock — reacts to PayPal's earnings release and guidance figures. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Why HP (HPQ) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: Shares of personal computing and printing company HP (NYSE:HPQ) fell 5.5% in the morning session after the company announced the immediate resignation of its CEO, Enrique Lores, which was followed by downgrades from several investment banks. Lores stepped down from his role as President, CEO, and board member to become the new chief executive at PayPal.

headline: PayPal (PYPL) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Jamie Miller: Before we turn to our full year and fourth quarter, I want to address the leadership announcement we made earlier this morning.  The board has appointed Enrique Lopez, who was most recently our board chair, as the next president and CEO of PayPal Holdings, Inc. effective March 1.  To accelerate execution and bring greater discipline to how we implement our strategic priorities as we enter our next phase of growth.

raw.headline: PayPal (PYPL) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
raw.summary: Jamie Miller: Before we turn to our full year and fourth quarter, I want to address the leadership announcement we made earlier this morning.  The board has appointed Enrique Lopez, who was most recently our board chair, as the next president and CEO of PayPal Holdings, Inc. effective March 1.  To accelerate execution and bring greater discipline to how we implement our strategic priorities as we enter our next phase of growth.

headline: PayPal replaces CEO Chriss with HP's Lores
summary: PayPal is replacing CEO Alex Chriss with Enrique Lores, saying that the pace of change and execution at the company has not met board expectations over the past two years.  Lores has served as a PayPal board member for almost five years and has been board Chair since July 2024.  “The payments industry is changing faster than ever, driven by new technologies, evolving regulations, an increasingly competitive landscape, and the rapid acceleration of AI that is reshaping commerce daily,” Lores said in a statement on Tuesday.

headline: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Palantir, Teradyne, Tesla, AMD, NXP Semiconductors, and More
summary: Stock futures were rising Tuesday as Palantir’s strong earnings injected renewed optimism around the artificial-intelligence trade.  Palantir Technologies  jumped 10% in premarket trading after the company, which sells artificial-intelligence software to manage and analyze large amounts of data, reported better-than expected fourth-quarter adjusted earnings.  Revenue jumped 70% from a year earlier to a record $1.41 billion on strong demand for its AI technology.

headline: PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 CY2025 Earnings, Stock Drops 14.6%
summary: Digital payments platform PayPal (NASDAQ:PYPL) fell short of the markets revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025 as sales rose 3.7% year on year to $8.68 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.23 per share was 4.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Paypal: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 14 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.29 per share. The technology platform and digital payments company posted revenue of $8.68 billion in the period, which also missed Street forecasts. Twelve analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $8.77 billion.

headline: PayPal sees 2026 profit below estimates, names HP's Lores as CEO
summary: PayPal issued a lackluster profit forecast for 2026 and reported fourth-quarter earnings below Wall Street expectations on Tuesday, while naming HP's Enrique Lores as its president ​and CEO.  Shares of the company slumped nearly 16% in premarket trading, after the payments giant's board ‌said the pace of change and execution under current CEO Alex Chriss was not in line with its expectations.  Chriss was tasked with ‌steering PayPal through a challenging period as post-pandemic trading volumes declined and competitive pressures in its core business from large technology companies and newer fintech rivals intensified.

Chriss was tasked with ‌steering PayPal through a challenging period as post-pandemic trading volumes declined and competitive pressures in its core business from large technology companies and newer fintech rivals intensified.

headline: PayPal Appoints Enrique Lores as Chief Executive Officer and David W. Dorman as Independent Board Chair
summary: PayPal Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: PYPL) today announced that its Board of Directors has appointed Enrique Lores as President and CEO, effective March 1, 2026. Lores, who has served on the PayPal Board for nearly five years and as Board Chair since July 2024, succeeds Alex Chriss. To ensure a seamless transition, Jamie Miller, Chief Financial and Operating Officer, will serve as Interim CEO until Lores assumes the role. David W. Dorman has been appointed as Independent Board Chair, effective immediat

headline: PayPal Text Payments Push Deeper Into Daily Use As Valuation Lags
summary: PayPal Holdings (NasdaqGS:PYPL) has partnered with Authvia to let PayPal and Venmo users send and receive payments through text messaging and RCS. The company is also working with april to connect payments to tax filing and with Blackhawk Network to support gift card purchases. These moves aim to extend PayPal's role in everyday financial tasks and service payments beyond traditional e commerce.
